docs.abstract: Ten voices from around the world reflect on performing in — and ushering and seeing — some of the first live shows since March.
docs.snippet: Ten voices from around the world reflect on performing in — and ushering and seeing — some of the first live shows since March.
docs.lead_paragraph: Eye contact is gone. Stilettos are swapped for slippers or sneakers. Songs are passionately delivered to laptop screens.

headline.main: ‘I Even Missed the Smell’: What It’s Like to Be Back at the Theater
headline.print_headline: Tipping Their Hats to Live Theater Again

docs.abstract: In a rare interview, the self-exiled “artist formerly known as African-American” talks about her art and philosophy.
docs.snippet: In a rare interview, the self-exiled “artist formerly known as African-American” talks about her art and philosophy.
docs.lead_paragraph: Adrian Piper is a conceptual artist and analytic philosopher based in Berlin. She has been written about often this year because of the retrospective of her work now on view at the Museum of Modern Art, “Adrian Piper: A Synthesis of Intuitions, 1965-2016,” the largest show the museum has ever assembled for a living artist. But that coverage has been generated by others, not by Piper herself, and it has not dealt in detail with her work and career in philosophy. This extended interview with Piper, conducted by email in May and June, attempts to fill those gaps.

docs.abstract: The unusual strategy to slow the promotions until after the election — intended to protect the officers’ accomplished careers — was devised by top Pentagon leaders.
docs.snippet: The unusual strategy to slow the promotions until after the election — intended to protect the officers’ accomplished careers — was devised by top Pentagon leaders.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Biden has nominated two female generals to elite, four-star commands, the Defense Department announced, months after their Pentagon bosses had agreed on their promotions but held them back out of fears that President Donald J. Trump would reject the officers because they were women.

headline.main: Biden Endorses Female Generals Whose Promotions Were Delayed Over Fears of Trump’s Reaction
headline.print_headline: Female Generals Receive Endorsement From Biden

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces

byline.original: By Eric Schmitt and Helene Cooper

docs.abstract: White supremacy is the biggest racial problem this country faces, and has faced.
docs.snippet: White supremacy is the biggest racial problem this country faces, and has faced.
docs.lead_paragraph: Now that we are deep into protests over racism, inequality and police brutality — protests that I’ve come to see as a revisiting of Freedom Summer —  it is clear that Donald Trump sees the activation of white nationalism and anti-otherness as his path to re-election. We are engaged in yet another national conversation about race and racism, privilege and oppression.

docs.abstract: Among the performances you can catch online are a one-woman show about sexual assault and riffs on “Heart of Darkness” and “Rocky.”
docs.snippet: Among the performances you can catch online are a one-woman show about sexual assault and riffs on “Heart of Darkness” and “Rocky.”
docs.lead_paragraph: Most Augusts, the Edinburgh Festival Fringe presents thousands of live performances in the Scottish capital, saving some of its most unusual specimens for a subfestival called the Zoo. Not this August, sadly, and yet the cessation of live theater has made the teeming collection of dance, performance and physical theater available to a much wider audience online, under the rubric Zoo TV. Our critics had a look around at offerings — some new, some old, all Fringe — that ranged from unwatchable to unforgettable.

headline.main: Direct from Edinburgh: Theaters Are Closed, but a ‘Zoo’ Is Open
headline.print_headline: Theaters Close, but the Zoo Stays Open

byline.original: By Jesse Green, Alexis Soloski and Elisabeth Vincentelli

docs.abstract: Listen to a collection of episodes on “The Daily” that examine the public reckoning with racial injustice in 2020.
docs.snippet: Listen to a collection of episodes on “The Daily” that examine the public reckoning with racial injustice in 2020.
docs.lead_paragraph: Against the backdrop of a pandemic and economic crisis, the summer of 2020 became a season of protest after the killing of George Floyd and other Black Americans by the police. “The Daily” shared with its listeners the voices of people who rose up in anger and anguish as the country grappled with the legacy of police brutality and racial justice.

headline.main: A Nation in Pain: ‘The Daily’ Covers the Effects of Centuries of Systemic Racism in the U.S.

docs.snippet: “The Best Man: The Final Chapters,” a new series sequel to the popular films, deepens the franchise’s female characters, introduces new faces and tackles a wider range of issues.
docs.lead_paragraph: The broom-jumping romantic comedy “The Best Man” debuted in theaters in 1999, delivering a bougie Black bonanza that would prove to have true staying power.

headline.print_headline: This ‘Best Man’ Offers Equal Time to Women

docs.abstract: The magazine’s Ethicist columnist on the pros and cons of virtue signaling — and more.
docs.snippet: The magazine’s Ethicist columnist on the pros and cons of virtue signaling — and more.
docs.lead_paragraph: I am a white college student trying to be a better racial-justice advocate in the wake of George Floyd’s death. While I have not been very politically active in the past (which I regret), recently I have attended a protest, donated a lot of my savings to bail funds and related nonprofits, called my representatives about these issues and tried to educate myself about black history and black voices. However, I have not posted on my personal social media regarding Black Lives Matter. I don’t think I have a unique perspective to add to this conversation, and I don’t like the scrutiny that comes with a social media post. I also worry that if I do post about Black Lives Matter, it would be motivated mainly by virtue signaling.

headline.main: I’ve Protested for Racial Justice. Do I Have to Post on Social Media?
headline.print_headline: I’ve Protested for Racial Justice. Do I Have to Post on Social Media Too?

docs.abstract: A feminist and a self-proclaimed revolutionary, she was in the forefront of the fledgling movement for economic and political equality in the 1940s.
docs.snippet: A feminist and a self-proclaimed revolutionary, she was in the forefront of the fledgling movement for economic and political equality in the 1940s.
docs.lead_paragraph: Esther Cooper Jackson, whose voice for racial equality in the 1940s would elevate her into the vanguard of the civil rights revolution of the mid-20th century, died in Boston on Aug. 23, two days after her 105th birthday.

headline.main: Esther Cooper Jackson, Civil Rights Pioneer, Dies at 105
headline.print_headline: Esther Cooper Jackson, 105, Dies; Pioneer of Civil Rights Movement
